testimony.quarrel_subject: court ruling against Jacquotte 2 years before

timeline.subject: Jacquotte Gardeux
timeline.details: Prévôt of Chatenois arrests Jacquotte on accusation by Jean Rouyer, prisoner at Houecourt. Begins taking depositions produced by Claude Utchin, substitut for PG des Vosges

timeline.subject: Jean Rouyer
timeline.details: At Houecourt where Jean Rouyer and Mathieu Amand about to be executed, prévôt interrogates Rouyer about denunciations. Confirms accusations against Jacquotte, Marie Canot, Mongeotte, and Estienne in their presence. Names additional accomplices

timeline.subject: Jacquotte and Marie
timeline.details: Prévôt orders Jacquotte and Marie held as prisoners in chateau at Chatenois, while Mongeotte and Estienne under house arrest. Additional informations taken

timeline.subject: Jacquotte Gardeux
timeline.details: Jacquotte interrogated about background, family, occupation, and accusations. Denies all charges

timeline.subject: Marie Canot
timeline.details: Marie interrogated about background and accusations. Denies all, claims Cabled family prompted Rouyer's accusation due to dispute over horse death

timeline.subject: Jacquotte and Marie
timeline.details: Both women confronted with witnesses. Jacquotte makes extensive counter-accusations against witnesses (theft, adultery, etc.). Marie objects to Cabled family as personal enemies

timeline.subject: Jacquotte and Marie
timeline.details: PG des Vosges requests both be tortured, admits charges against Jacquotte stronger

timeline.subject: Jacquotte and Marie
timeline.details: Change de Nancy advises Jacquotte be tortured 'mediocrement', Marie merely shown instruments and interrogated

timeline.subject: Jacquotte Gardeux
timeline.details: Jacquotte tortured for hour and half - thrown 4 times into cold water, racked, water poured into mouth while racked. Stubbornly denied all charges

timeline.subject: Marie Canot
timeline.details: Marie placed on rack but not tortured. Denied charges 'fort constamment' with tears and groans

timeline.subject: Jacquotte Gardeux
timeline.details: Change de Nancy declares Jacquotte should be 'renvoyée jusqu'à rappel' (released subject to recall)

timeline.subject: Jacquotte Gardeux
timeline.details: Court at Chatenois releases Jacquotte with injunction to behave 'plus modestement' in future. Marie presumably released as well

methods: water torture (poured into mouth while racked)
torture.restrictions: mediocrement (moderate) for Jacquotte; Marie only to be shown instruments

accomplices_named.name: Mongeotte veuve Gerard Aubry
accomplices_named.context: Named by Jean Rouyer on scaffold, placed under house arrest but evidence weak

accomplices_named.name: Estienne fils Alaphe Renard Violeur
accomplices_named.context: Named by Jean Rouyer on scaffold, placed under house arrest

accomplices_named.name: le grand marchal Jean de Paret
accomplices_named.context: Additional accusation by Jean Rouyer from scaffold

accomplices_named.name: Thiebault Brochet
accomplices_named.context: Additional accusation by Jean Rouyer from scaffold

accomplices_named.name: Pierot Pastenier
accomplices_named.context: Additional accusation by Jean Rouyer from scaffold

prior_accusations.context: Accused Jacquotte and Marie while imprisoned on witchcraft charges, confirmed accusation on scaffold before execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Cathin Gegoult
notable_quotes.french: something which smelt had come out of the 'devantier de taffetas' and gone round her head
notable_quotes.english: something which smelt had come out of the taffeta apron and gone round her head
notable_quotes.context: Cathin describing her bewitchment symptoms before death

notable_quotes.speaker: Jacquotte Gardeux
notable_quotes.french: elle ne vouloit pas dire qu'elle estoit engenauchée aussy bien que les aultres
notable_quotes.english: wouldn't she say that she was bewitched just like the others
notable_quotes.context: Jacquotte asking victim's mother if she would admit to bewitchment

notable_quotes.speaker: Jacquotte Gardeux
notable_quotes.context: Threat/curse uttered when mother admitted to being bewitched

notable_quotes.speaker: Jacquotte Gardeux
notable_quotes.french: faulx juges en leur justice et que par le nom de dieu il s'en doneroit de garde et s'en repentiroit quand il penseroit qu'elle l'eust obligé
notable_quotes.english: false judges in their justice and that by God's name he should be on guard and would repent when he thought she had obliged him
notable_quotes.context: Jacquotte's threat to maire after losing slander case

notable_quotes.speaker: Jacquotte Gardeux
notable_quotes.french: qu'on la suspitionnoit d'estre genoiche et d'avoir faict mourir Cathin la femme Nicolas Gegoult mais qu'on verroit et cognoisteroit on cy apres ceux qui estoient genoches
notable_quotes.english: that she was suspected of being a witch and of having killed Cathin wife of Nicolas Gegoult but that one would see and know hereafter who were the witches
notable_quotes.context: Jacquotte's counter-threat while working with other women, before striking Cathin Cabled's knee

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie Canot
notable_quotes.french: qu'il fault bien qu'il fut esté poussé et incité de ce faire par aucuns que luy veult mal pour ce que ledict Rouyer accusoit ung chacun qu'on vouloit mesme par apres les deschargeoit
notable_quotes.english: that he must have been pushed and incited to do this by some who wish her ill because the said Rouyer accused anyone people wanted and even afterwards discharged them
notable_quotes.context: Marie claiming Rouyer was manipulated to accuse her

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie Canot
notable_quotes.french: pour ce qu'ils sont pauvres gens elle et son marit sont esté contraints d'endurer ledict tort d'eux qui sont riches et forts
notable_quotes.english: because they are poor people she and her husband have been forced to endure this wrong from those who are rich and powerful
notable_quotes.context: Marie explaining why she couldn't seek legal redress against Cabled family

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie Canot (via Thierry Toussainct)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ne vouloit aller parler audict Rouyer accusateur pour ce qu'elle le connessoit mauvais guerson, qu'il luy soustiendroit qu'elle estoit sorciere
notable_quotes.english: that she didn't want to go speak to the said Rouyer accuser because she knew him to be a bad fellow, that he would insist she was a witch
notable_quotes.context: Marie's fear of confronting Rouyer before arrest

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie Canot (via Thierry Toussainct)
notable_quotes.french: sy elle estoit prinse qu'on luy donnoit la question et qu'il luy faudroit dire sur ce parce qu'elle estoit de petite complexion
notable_quotes.english: if she was arrested they would give her the question (torture) and she would have to say whatever because she was of small constitution
notable_quotes.context: Marie's fear that torture would force false confession

notable_quotes.speaker: Jacquotte Gardeux
notable_quotes.context: Explaining husband's grain theft 12 years earlier

notable_quotes.speaker: PG des Vosges
notable_quotes.french: l'atrocité du crime duquel elles sont prevenues, a la qualité d'iceluy que toutes personnes indifferement soient de bonne fame ou non, sont admises et receues à deposer valablement, tant tel crime, qui est de lèse majesté divine et humaine a toujours esté, et est en horreur
notable_quotes.english: the atrocity of the crime of which they are accused, such that all persons indifferently whether of good fame or not, are admitted and received to testify validly, such a crime being one of lèse majesté divine and human has always been and is held in horror
notable_quotes.context: PG arguing witness objections should be disregarded due to nature of witchcraft crime

relationships.evidence_text: wife of Florentin Gardeux of la Neufville
daughter of Anthoine Perrin of Chatenois
daughter of... his wife Epnotte (from Parey-soubs-Montfort)
wife of Francois Canot of la Neufville
daughter of Claude Mengel of Parey-soubs-Montfort
his wife had died 3 years before
he and his brother Simonin had seen her
Lucresse femme de Gaspard de la Neufville
Thomasse femme à Claude Utchin substitut
Symonin Cabled fils de Claude Cabled
Had been sharing a house with accused
Claude Cabled qu'on dict collotte qui est parent à Ferry Boyart procureur

economic_context.details: Jacquotte's husband had been caught stealing grain 12 years earlier, whipped, banished 6 weeks, with property confiscated - crime committed 'par necessite et pauvreté'. Multiple disputes over payment/promises (devancier for wine, cherries, hay delivery, barley, lait de fromaige). Marie explicitly states class conflict: poor people forced to endure wrongs from 'riches et forts' (rich and powerful). Jacquotte and husband kept village sheep for ~9 years, did day labor, she spun. Both women from poor backgrounds doing subsistence work.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness lasting only one week; something smelling came out of taffeta apron and went round her head; claimed on deathbed it was Jacquotte's doing
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Cathin purchased wine for feast of Notre Dame, went to collect 'devancier' promised; Jacquotte took long time finding it in chest
harms_catalog.method_alleged: something in the taffeta apron that smelled

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jacquotte visited and asked if she would say she was bewitched like others; when she said yes, Jacquotte became angry

harms_catalog.harm_description: Three cows died just after calving
Illness in the head lasting 6 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused several times to do carting for her, then finally agreed
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 14 years before, when he finally did the carting

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Court ruled against Jacquotte in slander case; she threatened he would repent
harms_catalog.method_alleged: threat/curse, though not seen near horses

harms_catalog.harm_description: One sow and four piglets died

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Contract dispute - Cabled family contracted to bring hay with cart, didn't want to unload it; Marie was angry
harms_catalog.method_alleged: proximity - Marie seen near dying horse alone

harms_catalog.harm_description: Knee hurting badly after Jacquotte struck it
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: While working together ('carregeroient'), Jacquotte declared she was suspected of being witch and killing Cathin Gegoult, but 'one would see who were the witches'
Went to collect 2 pounds cherries Jacquotte promised; told she was 'bien hative' (too hasty)
Refused Mongeotte 'lait de fromaige' (whey) when she was guarding village sheep

harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 3 years earlier; Jacquotte in house on day he fell ill
harms_catalog.method_alleged: presence in house on day of illness onset

harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: when they were neighbors 3 years before

Location of court/chateau where Jacquotte and Marie imprisoned; birthplace of Jacquotte; home of prévôt

Prison where Jacquotte and Marie held

weather_events: Stormy weather 2 years before trial when Jacquotte stopped husband from sounding trumpet to recall sheep, saying storm would do no harm
economic_hardship_indicators: Jacquotte's husband stole grain 'par necessite et pauvreté' (by necessity and poverty) 12 years earlier
Jacquotte and mother supported household by spinning and day labor done by poor
Both Jacquotte and Marie did day work for subsistence
Marie explicitly states poverty: 'pauvres gens' forced to endure wrongs from 'riches et forts'
Multiple disputes over small economic transactions (barley, whey, cherries, hay)
Jacquotte kept village sheep for ~9 years as occupation
religious_calendar_references: feast of Notre Dame (when wine purchase occurred)

prior_legal_disputes.description: 12 years earlier, Florentin Gardeux (Jacquotte's husband) caught stealing grain
3 years before trial, Jacquotte's husband brought slander case against Claudet Cabled (via his son Claudet) for calling her witch
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Court ruled against Jacquotte; her husband made to pay fine

legal_context.redress_outcome: Lost case, husband fined, which led to threats against maire and further suspicions
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Jacquotte and Marie held in chateau at Chatenois; Mongeotte and Estienne under house arrest

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Jacquotte to be tortured 'mediocrement' (moderately), Marie only to be shown instruments of torture

hearsay_chains.content: Had heard her daughter accuse Jacquotte of bewitching her
Told similar story of Cathin's sickness and death
Repeated account of Cathin's death and the smelling thing from taffeta apron
Jacquotte told witness she regretted threatening maire, worried she'd be blamed if something happened to him
Cathin told witness her knee was hurting badly after Jacquotte struck it

emotional_state_notes: Jacquotte: angry during confrontations, defiant, made extensive counter-accusations
Jacquotte: stubbornly denied all charges during torture for 1.5 hours
Marie: 'fort estonnée' (very shocked) when first accused
Marie: denied charges 'fort constamment' (very constantly) with tears and groans during interrogation on rack
Marie: fearful before arrest - worried torture would force false confession due to 'petite complexion'

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Called Cathin Thouvenel 'putain et parjure' - committed adultery with Messire Dominique Utin
Lucresse wife of Gaspard Vannier had bastard daughter by Messire Pierot Gueniot
Halbix wife of Matheu Varrin caught 'paillardant' with Claude Rigault - witness so angry she tried to beat Jacquotte with stick
Ysabeau wife of Jehan Vannier is thief and whore; first husband died of grief at this
Ysabel wife of Jacques Gudine is thief and whore with bastard daughter
Said of Andreu Balle the miller that 'all millers were thieves, and as a miller he was like all the others'
Marie said Claudet Cabled was personal enemy who unjustly called her witch; repeated story that Cabled family attacked her over horse death

third_parties.name: Jean Rouyer
third_parties.context: Prisoner at Houecourt on witchcraft charges; accused Jacquotte and Marie; confirmed accusations on scaffold before execution

third_parties.name: Mathieu Amand
third_parties.context: Executed for witchcraft alongside Jean Rouyer at Houecourt

third_parties.name: Florentin Gardeux
third_parties.context: Shepherd; previously convicted of grain theft; brought slander case on wife's behalf

third_parties.name: Francois Canot
third_parties.context: Tried to hide Marie when she was accused; asked Thierry Toussainct for permission to keep her secretly

third_parties.name: Anthoine Perrin
third_parties.context: Violeur (musician) of Chatenois; poor, supported by wife and daughter's labor

third_parties.name: Epnotte
third_parties.context: From Parey-soubs-Montfort; supported household by spinning and day labor

third_parties.name: Cathin Gegoult
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: wife of witness 1, daughter of witness 5
third_parties.context: Died after week-long illness; claimed on deathbed Jacquotte bewitched her via taffeta apron; central victim in multiple testimonies

third_parties.name: Didier Mathiot
third_parties.context: Of Noaillancourt; Jacquotte spent 10 weeks in his house before marriage

third_parties.name: Matheu Varrin
third_parties.context: Sold garden to Jacquotte previous year; husband of witness 5 (Halbix)

third_parties.name: Messire Dominique Utin
third_parties.context: Jacquotte accused Cathin Thouvenel of adultery with him

third_parties.name: Messire Pierot Gueniot
third_parties.context: Of Neuveville; Jacquotte accused Lucresse of having bastard daughter by him

third_parties.name: Claude Rigault
third_parties.context: Jacquotte accused Halbix of adultery with him; Halbix became so angry she tried to beat Jacquotte

third_parties.name: Simonin Cabled
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: called Jacquotte witch; subject of slander case
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: brother of Claudet (witness 11), son of Claude and Jannon Cabled
third_parties.context: With brother found Marie near dying horse; had called Jacquotte witch leading to slander lawsuit

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a particularly rich trial record with two accused women who were both released. Exceptional detail on: (1) class conflict - both women poor, Marie explicitly states 'riches et forts' persecute them; (2) prior legal history - slander case backfired on Jacquotte; (3) defense strategies - Jacquotte's aggressive counter-accusations of adultery/theft against witnesses; (4) Marie's sophisticated understanding of legal process and fear of torture; (5) resistance to torture - Jacquotte withstood 1.5 hours; (6) economic disputes underlying accusations (grain, cherries, hay, barley, whey); (7) scaffold denunciation by condemned witch Jean Rouyer as trigger; (8) extensive harms catalog (15+ incidents) mostly livestock deaths; (9) gender dynamics - most witnesses female; (10) Change de Nancy showing restraint - moderate torture only, then release. Trial exemplifies how poor women navigated accusations through a combination of defiance (Jacquotte) and strategic victimhood (Marie).
